content: the top of the next stitch to secure the edge of the scale *skip 3 double_crochet posts from the previous round and place 5 double_crochet around the post of the 4th stitch turn work 180 degrees and place 5 double_crochet around the next double_crochet post from the previous round skip one stitch then slip_stitch into the top of the next stitch to secure the edge of the scale* when you complete the round you should have 10 dragon scales round 8 chain 3 double_crochet into the same space below the starting chain *3 evenly spaced double_crochet into the top of the scale from the previous round 2 double_crochet between scales from the previous round * join with slip_stitch to beginning of round this will be the basis for the next row of scales and forms a modified crocodile stitch the additional stitches in the top of each scale will reduce gaps in the finished work 50 round 9 chain 3 4 double_crochet around the post of the first double_crochet from the previous round turn work 180 degrees and place 5 double_crochet around the post of the second double_crochet from the previous round skip 1 stitch and slip_stitch into the top of the stitch in the center of the lower scale to secure the edge of the scale just finished the scales in each subsequent row will overlap the scales below such that the center of each new scale falls in between two scales from the round below *identify the 2 double_crochet posts that fall between the next two scales place 5 double_crochet around each post and secure with a slip_stitch in the top of the stitch at the center of the next scale* around rounds 10-26 repeat round 8 and round 9 until 10 rounds of scales have been formed you will end on repeat of round 8 page 6 t o p o f t h e b a g round 27 chain 2 and half_double_crochet around 50 round 28 chain 2 half_double_crochet into the next 2 stitches then half_double_crochet decrease *3 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet decrease* around join with slip_stitch to start of round 40 round 29 chain 2 half_double_crochet into next stitch then half_double_crochet decrease *2 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet decrease* around join with slip_stitch to start of round 30 round 30 chain 4 counts as first double_crochet + chain 1 skip 1 stitch *double_crochet chain 1 skip 1* around this round forms the spaces for the drawstring round 31 chain 1 *2 single_crochet in each chain 1 space from the previous round single_crochet into the top of each double_crochet from the previous round* around join with slip_stitch and bind off d r a w s t r i n g cut a length of ribbon approximately twenty inches in length and thread through the holes created by round 30 add beads to the ends of the ribbons if desired post your images to instagram with #thedragonslayerbag and tag me @fisherfiberarts i can t wait to see what you create page
